page.title: 10Ecology and the Environment
page.content: Designated a conservation area, one of the major concerns is the disappearing hedgerows which have followed the introduction of highly mechanised intensive farming. There is evidence that farmers are now much more concerned about the environment,and there is hope for the future, but meanwhile the damage has been done and the appearance of the landscape has much changed. Stubble burning, although on the whole well controlled by local farmers, is another concern, though inevitably they have a different perspective from non- farmers. There is still a wide variety of wildlife in the 3 main habitats - open land, woodlands, and rivers and ponds. This includes the badger, fox, rabbit, stoat, weasle, mole and hare as well as two kinds of deer.
